context: The Estonian word 'magama' primarily means 'to sleep'. It's a verb used to describe the state of being asleep or the action of going to sleep. It can also be used in extended meanings such as 'being inactive' (like fields sleeping under snow) or in informal speech meaning 'to have sexual intercourse with someone'. The word has various forms including magan (I sleep), magad (you sleep), magab (he/she/it sleeps), magame (we sleep), magate (you [plural] sleep), and magavad (they sleep).
